cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest through the Florida Straits, expected to cross the Florida Keys and then turn west into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida coast from Golden Beach to Bonita Beach (Hurricane Watch); Cuban provinces La Habana westward and Isle of Youth (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas including Florida Bay (Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warnings); south-central Florida coast and NW Bahamas (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, north coast of Cuba, northwestern Bahamas, and Gulf waters; minor surge (1–2 ft) possible as far north as Altamaha Sound, GA
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤7% chance of 34-kt winds at any time in next 5 days)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia coast, including near Savannah, due to onshore flow when Eta is in the Gulf
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate showers possible; widespread heavy rainfall not expected at Savannah
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas along offshore approach channels
